page.title: 13THE SEA AT HASTINGS
page.content: The sea provides Hastings with much employment. The beach is a place for recreation and is the basis of the tourism industry. There is still a small fishing fleet although only 30 families are involved. The fish caught include cod, plaice, whiting, macheral and dabs. There are many anglers who fish for sport and there are 4 fishing clubs in the town. People fish from the beach, the pier and from inshore boats which often fish above wrecks. The beach can suffer badly from polution. Oil from ships often leaves black tar on the shingle and there is a lot of rubbish washed up on the beach. Sometimes treasure trovers search the beach with metal detectors.
